column4: After i installed the b43 driver for my wifi adapter and rebooted ubuntu, it is completely gone! Not even lspci shows it anymore (which it did before) someone please help!
b43 should be in kernel since some kernel version .. is "lsmod|grep b43" showing something?
it shows b43 to be loaded among other modules
hmm no actually nothing changed, lspci still doesnt show it, neither does the driver manager show b43 to be loaded and iwconfig is still the same too :(
erUSUL yes, i will try reinstalling it again. I tried once already using synaptic, but ill try using apt-get too
erUSUL if this doesnt work ill just use my usb stick and reinstall the whole box again
erUSUL on a sidenote i should maybe mention that the Wifi on/off button on my laptop that runs it doesnt work, the led stays off, but the bios says its on
erUSUL well, i did the whole tailf and modprobe thing after reinstalling fwcutter, but its still the same

probably it won't work .. on my brothers laptop it's the same ... you even can't enable the switch in bios, you can only enable "last state" .. my brother had to install windows, enable the wifi, and then reinstall his ubuntu ..
well wifi is enabled in bios though
uuh there is a LAN/WLAN switching option which is off
erUSUL i rebooted with my ethernet cable pulled out and now it shows up and works perfectly
nah actually no, i actually rebooted a few times before
